properties.otherAdvice:
Banna Avenue will be closed between Crossing Street and Jondaryan Avenue for the Griffith Citrus Sculptures at the following times:

  • Set up - Sun 13 Oct 6am-2:30pm
  • Event launch - Fri 18 Oct 4:30pm-10:30pm
  • Pack up - Sun 27 Oct 6am-2:30pm

Detours will be in place for light and heavy vehicles.
properties.diversions:
Heavy vehicle detour via Bridge St and Crossing St during the exhibition.

Light vehicles will be detoured via Yambil St during the event launch.

All vehicles will be detoured via Bridge St and Crossing St during the installation and pack up of the event.

properties.publicTransport: Extra trains will run for event participants. Visit transportnsw.info for more details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 10,000 cyclists will ride from Sydney to Wollongong for the annual MS Gong Ride.Â The 82 km ride from Tempe Recreation Reserve starts from 6am and the 54km ride will start at Preston Park, Engadine from 8am. Both events finish at Lang Park, Wollongong by 4:30pm.

Road and lane closures will be in place along sections of the course.

  • 4am to 9:30am from Tempe to Sutherland:Â sections of West Botany St, Holbeach Ave and Bestic St. The speed limit will be reduced to 60/km along Rocky Point Rd/Taren Point Rd from Sans Souci to Taren Point.
  • 5am to 10amÂ from Sutherland to Waterfall:Â Lane closures on the Princes Hwy from Kirrawee to Loftus and the speed limit will be reduced to 60km/h from Kirrawee to Waterfall. Delays are expected travelling southbound on the Princes Hwy during this time.Â 
  • 5am to 2:30pm in theÂ Royal National Park:Â McKell Ave, Lady Wakehurst Dr, Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Otford Rd. Access to the Royal National Park is via Farnell Ave only. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h along Lawrence Hargrave Dr from Stanwell Park to Thirroul from 6am to 3pm.
  • 5am to 4.30pmÂ inÂ Wollongong:Â sections of Bourke St, Cliff Rd and George Hanley Dr will be closed. Sections of Hector St, Marine Dr and Hinton St around the finish area at Lang Park will remain closed until 7pm. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h along Squires Way and George Hanley Dr between Fairy Meadow and Wollongong from 7am to 2pm

Motorists should exercise caution as cyclists will be sharing some roads along the course. Motorists are reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

Special event clearways will be in place along key sections of the course between 4am and 4:30pm. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.ï»¿

properties.otherAdvice: Heavy traffic is expected on Goldfields Way, Temora for the 2024 Warbirds Downunder airshow. Motorists can expect delays and should allow additional travel time.

The Mitchell Hwy (Summer St) will be closed eastbound between Sale St and McNamara Ln. The closure will be a 'rolling closure' managed by NSW Police. Westbound traffic will be largely unaffected, however there will be no access from Summer St into McNamara Ln, Lords Pl, Anson St and Sale St intersections. All intersections will have traffic controllers.

Murrumbateman Field Days is expected to attract approx. 20,000 people across the two days of the event.

It is expected that traffic will be heavy along the Barton Highway for the duration of the event.

Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place on Barton Hwy at the Field Days entrance.
properties.diversions: Northbound motorists heading to the event will be detoured via Euroka Ave, Patemans Ln and Murrumbateman Rd with access to car parking via Murrumbateman Rd.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Wandandian Expo 2024, will take place on Sunday 20 October, from 8am to 2pm at the Wandandian Progress Hall. The expo features a woodchop competition, a classic car show, and community stalls.Â 

A reduced speed limit will be in place on the Princes Hwy and traffic controllers will be on site to direct motorists and pedestrians.

properties.publicTransport: Free Shuttle buses for participants. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
J.P. Morgan Corporate Challenge in Centennial Parklands. Event village opens at 5pm, race starts at 6:30pm and event finish around 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual approaching Centennial Park as participants travel to the event.

Grand Dr will be closed all day between CafÃ© Corner and Hamilton Dr intersection. Sections of Hamilton Dr, Carrington Dr, Dickens Dr and Loch Ave will close from 1pm.

No vehicles are permitted to enter the Park after 1pm. Any vehicles inside the park must exit via the Randwick Gates by 5pm.

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and to be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Oxford Street, Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets series on Crown Street

properties.publicTransport: Route 304 and 352 buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip atÂ transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Crown Street on Saturday 2 November. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

  • Crown St will be closed in both directions between Cleveland St and Foveaux St from 8am until 11:30pm
  • Sections of Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Devonshire St, Jesson Ln, Jesson St, High Holborn St, Landsowne St, Miles St, Rainford St and Withers Ln will also be closed.
  • Motorists travelling from the south towards the city should detour via Cleveland St, Elizabeth St and Albion St.
  • Motorists travelling from the north should detour via Foveaux St, Elizabeth St and Cleveland St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am until 11:30pm on sections of Crown St, Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Landsdowne St, Rainford St and Withers Ln.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Melbourne United at WIN Entertainment Centre. Tip-off at 7:30pm, full time around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists are advised to allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Perth Glory at Campbelltown Sports Stadium on Sunday 20 October. Kick-off from 4pm, full time around 5:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd. Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.publicTransport: VisitÂ transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Karan Aujila at Qudos Bank Arena on Friday 25 October. Doors open 7pm and show runs from 8pm until 10:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as ticketholders travel in the already busy evening peak.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parkingÂ online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Oktoberfest in the Gardens at The Domain from 1pm to 9pm.

Thousands of revellers are expected at Australiaâs biggest Oktoberfest celebration at the Phillip Precinct in The Domain.

Traffic will be heavier than usual in the Sydney CBD on approaches to The Domain. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

A dedicated drop off zone will be located on Hospital Rd at Art Gallery Rd.

roads.mainStreet: Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, College St, Art Gallery Rd

properties.publicTransport: VisitÂ transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Sydney Kings v NZ Breakers at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip-off from 2.15pm, full time around 4.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the game. Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parkingÂ online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip by public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
The RAAF Base Richmond Community Open at RAAF Base on Saturday 26 October. The event starts at 9am and finishes at 3pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the site as attendees travel to the event.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on approach to RAAF Base Richmond especially alongÂ Richmond Road, Windsor Road, Hawkesbury Valley Way and The Northern Road.

If you have to drive, allow plenty of extra travel time as delays are expected. Travel with your group and aim to arrive early to avoid the delays and secure parking.Â

Fast and Loud 2024 will be held from Friday 18 to Sunday 20 October in Warners Bay. On Saturday 19 October, there will be a number of road closures, including:

  • The Esplanade from Lake Street to King Street between 3pm to 8pm
  • Brooks Parade from Sharp Street to Maude Street between 9am - 5pm

Traffic controllers will be on site to direct motorists.
properties.diversions:
The following detours will be in place:

  • The Esplanade detour via Medcalf Street and King Street. Local traffic heading southbound will detour via Lake Street and Charles Street.
  • Brooks Parade detour via Sharp Street and Maude Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Ghost In The Rocks Festival in Circular Quay from Thursday 31 October to Sunday 3 November. A variety of events will be taking place at First Fleet Park, Tallawoladah Lawn, George Street Alfresco Area, and in The Rocks including Jack Mundy, Playfair Street, Foundation Park and Atherden Street.

On Saturday 2 November from 5pm George St will be closed temporarily between Jack Mundy Place and Circular Quay West for a Halloween Parade.

Allow extra time in the area as roads may be busier than usual throughout the event as crowds make their way to and from the events.

properties.publicTransport: Route 437, 440 and 445 bus services will be diverting while road closures are in place. VisitÂ transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Italian Festa held along Norton Street from 10am to 5pm.Â 

Traffic will be heavy in the area and on approach to Leichhardt, including on Parramatta Rd and the City West Link. Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and expect delays.

Norton St will be closed between Marion St and William St from 3am to 9pm. Other local roads around Norton St will also be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect on sections of Norton Street and William St from 3am to 9pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.ï»¿

properties.otherAdvice:
Stray Kids World Tour at Allianz Stadium. Concert starts from 7.30pm, and finishes around 10.30pm.

With a crowd of 40,000 fans expected, traffic delays are expected on roads approaching Moore Park.

Motorists should expect delays and allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. Attendees are urged to catch public transport.

Changed traffic conditions

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 12pm and will reopen once crowds have safely left the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave however access to EP3 grass car park, EP2 car park and drop off areas will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd. Please note EP2 parking is very limited due to upgrade works.
  • A pick up and drop off zone will be located on the northern side of Moore Park Rd at Oatley Rd opposite the stadium.
  • The Moore Park Rd/Fitzroy St cycleway will be closed from Poate Rd to Bourke StÂ fromÂ 10pm to 11.30pm.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas on Saturday 26 October fromÂ 3pm to midnightÂ on sections of Albion Street, Fitzroy Street and Moore Park Road, and fromÂ 6am to midnightÂ on sections of Cleveland Street.Â Â 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at theÂ Find My CarÂ website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice: The Morisset Lake Macquarie Agricultural Show will be held on Saturday 19 October to Sunday 20 October at the Morisset Showground. There will be increased pedestrian activity as event goers make their way to and from the event. Traffic controllers will be on site to direct motorists on Saturday afternoon.

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Extra trains will run each night. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Weeknd After Hours Til Dawn Tour at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Gates open 5pm, support acts from 5pm, The Weeknd from 8.30pm and finish around 10:50pm.

Traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct each concert night as ticketholders travel in the already busy evening peak. Significant delays are expected on roads and entering car parks on Tuesday as a concert also takes place at neighbouring Qudos Bank Arena.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • Parking in the precinct is limited and selling fast. Concertgoers are urged to pre-book parking online to secure a space.Â 
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • If you have not pre-booked a space, follow the directions on variable message boards within the precinct.
  • Consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip on one of the many extra trains running to Olympic Park to avoid traffic delays, at no extra cost.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

Kangaroo Valley Folk FestivalÂ is back in 2024, a family-friendly event over three days.

Motorists should check signage on Moss Vale Rd and take caution in the area with an expected increase in pedestrian activity.

properties.publicTransport: Route 900 buses will be diverting while road closures are in place. VisitÂ transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Parramatta Lanes is taking place in the Parramatta CBD from Wednesday 23 to Saturday 26 October. Being held at over 16 sites including gardens, rooftop carparks and lanes, the event starts daily at 5pm. The event will finish at 10pm on Wednesday and Thursday, and at 10.30pm on Friday and Saturday.

Road closures will be in place from Wedenesday 23 to Sunday 27 October on sections of Macquarie St, Phillip St and George St to safely facilitate the event. Parking restrictions will also be in place on George St and Macquarie St, so check signs carefully.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the area and on detour routes as attendees travel to and from the event.

Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.is

Large crowds are expected to attend the Sydney Opera House Forecourt on Tuesday 22 October for the Royal Visit to NSW by His Majesty King Charles III and Her Majesty Queen Camilla. Entry opens from 3pm, the event will start at 4:20pm.

Allow extra time travelling in the area as traffic may be heavier than usual on approaches to the Opera House as attendees make their way to and from the event during the already busy weekday period. Public transport is the best way to get to the event.

properties.publicTransport: VisitÂ transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Olivia Rodrigo at Qudos Bank Arena on Thursday 17, Friday 18, Monday 21 and Tuesday 22 October. Doors open 6pm and show runs from 7.30pm until 10.20pm each concert night.

Traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct each concert night as ticketholders travel in the already busy evening peak. Significant delays are expected on roads and entering car parks on Tuesday as a concert also takes place at neighbouring Accor Stadium.Â Â 

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parkingÂ online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

properties.otherAdvice: The Lithgow Halloween Festival will be held on Saturday 26 October from 4pm to 10pm. The event takes place in the vicinity of the main CBD and there will be an increase in traffic volumes on both local and state networks. A small quantity of temporary traffic management signage will be installed on Chifley Road advising motorists of changed traffic conditions.

The Boorowa Touch and Netball Carnival is on Friday 25 October with changed traffic conditions in place from 8.30am to 4.30pm.

The carnival is expecting 7000 spectators and over 4,500 competitors from schools around Canberra and the State.

Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place on Jugiong Street to allow motorists to pass in one direction at a time.

A speed reduction of 40km/h will be in place on Lachlan Valley Way, Murringo Rd, Cunningar Rd, Bally Ryan Rd and Gereldine Rd.

The Oz Tag junior championship will be held at C.ex International Stadium 18-20 October.

Allow additional travel time if travelling to or around the event.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will run frequently between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Buses will be in high demand so allow extra travel time. Avoid the largest crowds by visiting on a weekday instead. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sculpture by the Sea exhibition returns to the Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk for 18 days from Friday 18 October to Monday 4 November. Changed traffic conditions and parking restrictions will be in place.

With up to 500,000 people expected to visit throughout the exhibition, significant delays are expected on roads approaching Bondi and Tamarama beaches including Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr.Â 

Motorists should avoid driving through the area where possible or expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time, particularly on weekends.

Road closures and changed traffic conditions:

  • Local roads will close from 7:30am to 6:30pm daily in Bronte, Bondi and Tamarama including sections of Ashley St, Bayview St, Birell St, Carlisle St, Darling St, Fletcher St. Illawong Ave, Kenneth St, Marks Ln, Notts Ave, Rowland Ave, Silvia St, Turner St, Wilga St and Wolaroi Cres.
  • One-way traffic conditions will be in place around the coastal walk for the duration of the event from 9am Friday 18 October until 10am Monday 4 November. Allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers and exercise caution.

Special event clearways: Strict parking restrictions will be in effect each weekend of the event on Saturday 19 and Sunday 20 October, Saturday 26 and Sunday 27 October and Saturday 2 and Sunday 3 November at the following times and locations:

  • 7am to 2pm: Bondi Rd between Old South Head and opposite Sandridge St at Bondi Beach (northern side)
  • 12pm midday to 7pm: Bondi Rd between Sandridge St at Bondi Beach and Oxford St at Bondi Junction (southern side)
  • 8am to 4pm: Campbell Pde between Queen Elizabeth Drive and Beach Rd at Bondi Beach (Eastern side)

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

A-League Men: Newcastle Jets v Melbourne City FC at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, full time around 6:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Sydney FC at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 7:35pm, full time around 9:30pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from 9.30pm until 10pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.Â 

  • OâConnell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from OâConnell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from OâConnell St to Villiers St

Roads around the stadium will close as crowds make their way to the game. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.

Changed traffic conditions include road closures and temporary no stopping zones will be in effect.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic in the area will be heavier than usual while closures and local traffic detours are in place.

Motorists should also exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Road closures

  • Between 5.30pm Friday 18 October and 10pm Saturday 19 October including sections of West Pde, Hillview Rd, Rowe St, Progress Ave, Coolgun Ln and Trelawney St.
  • 5am until 12pm Saturday only, closures will be in place on Lakeside Rd between Wingate Ave and Hillview Rd, and Clive Rd
  • 6am until 7pm Saturday only, closures will be in place on Hillview Ln between Shaftsbury Rd and Lakeside Rd, and Hillview Lane car park
  • 8am until 11.30am Saturday only, closures will be in place on sections of Lakeside Rd, Hillview Rd, Shaftsbury Rd, Rowe St, Glen St and Richards Ave.

Temporary no-stopping zones will be in effect from 3.30pm Friday 18 October on sections of Trelawney St, Hillview Rd and Lakeside Rd, and between 6am and 9am Saturday 19 October on sections of Rutledge St. Check signs carefully. For more information see the event website.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Up to 1,500 people are expected to participate in the annual Billbergia Bennelong Bridge Run today from 6.50am to 10am today. Changed traffic conditions including road closures are all now in place.

Motorists travelling around Rhodes, Wentworth Point and Olympic Park should allow additional travel time, follow diversions and directions of traffic controllers and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Road closures:

  • NOW CLOSED until 10am: sections of Wentworth Pl, Bennelong Bridge, Waterways St, Wentworth St, Shoreline Dr, Annie Leggett Promenade and Hill Rd.
  • CLOSED until 11am: sections of Marjorie Jackson Parkway and Holker Busway

Lane closures are also now in place on sections of Jamieson St and Holker St, along with stop/slow traffic conditions at the intersection of Hill Rd and Footbridge Boulevarde, and Jamieson St between Holker St and the shared pathway. Changed traffic conditions will return to normal at 10am and all roads will be reopened by 11am.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

Allow extra travel time on roads in the city and Pyrmont around Darling Harbour as traffic may be heavier than usual before and after events, particularly in peak travel times.

Motorists should exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.
